intro: Thrasya hitchcockii, commonly known as the Hitchcock's thrash, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
